LL100.name: Language for Study Abroad
LL100.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LL100.description: Study of the language associated with the host country in preparation for a study abroad program. Development of an emphasis on oral proficiency skills.

LL151.name: First-Year Less Commonly Taught Language I
LL151.description: Study of any of the less commonly taught languages at the elementary level. Speaking, listening, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Development of an emphasis on oral proficiency skills.

LL152.name: First-Year Less Commonly Taught Language II
LL152.description: Further work on speaking, listening, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of an emphasis on oral proficiency skills.

LL251.name: Second-Year Less Commonly Taught Language I
LL251.description: Intermediate-level work on speaking, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of oral proficiency skills.

LL252.name: Second-Year Less Commonly Taught Language II
LL252.description: Further intermediate-level work on speaking, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of oral proficiency skills.

LL261.name: Advanced Less Commonly Taught Language I
LL261.description: Advanced-level language class specifically for the heritage language speaker who acquired oral proficiency in the language at home or in a bilingual school environment. Development of advanced level oral and aural skills, as well as academic competence in the written language and acquisition of the writing system.

LL262.name: Advanced Less Commonly Taught Language II
LL262.description: Further advanced-level language study specifically for the heritage language speaker who acquired oral proficiency in the language at home or in a bilingual school environment. Development of near-native oral and aural skills, as well as native-like mastery of the written language and writing system.

LL290.name: Independent Study
LL290.description: Special projects in Linguistics and Languages arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

LL301.name: Third-Year Less Commonly Taught Language I
LL301.description: High-intermediate level work on speaking, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of oral proficiency skills.

LL302.name: Third-Year Less Commonly Taught Language II
LL302.description: Continued high-intermediate level work on speaking, listening, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of an emphasis on oral proficiency skills.

LL401.name: Fourth-Year Less Commonly Taught Language I
LL401.description: Advanced level work on speaking, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of oral proficiency skills.

LL402.name: Fourth-Year Less Commonly Taught Language II
LL402.description: Continued advanced level work on speaking, listening, reading, and writing a less commonly taught language. Continued development of an emphasis on oral proficiency skills.

LL490.name: Independent Study
LL490.description: Special projects in linguistics and languages arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

LL821.name: Proseminar in Comparative Literature
LL821.description: History and practice of comparative literature including foundational concepts and current directions.
LL821.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters.

LL823.name: Seminar in Comparative Literary Criticism
LL823.description: Theory and practice of comparative literary criticism, with attention to the development of critical approaches and to current topics in the critical literature.
LL823.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters.
